description.plain:
Bryce Ross-Johnson, known by his stage name Bryce Vine is an American rapper and singer from New York City, New York.
Bryce Vine showed an early interest in music, teaching himself guitar at 13 and later auditioning for the Fox show Glee.
While attending Berklee College of Music, he met Nolan Lambroza, who signed him to his record label, Kiva House Lambroza. Vine has released two EPs, Lazy Fair and Night Circus, and the hit single “Drew Barrymore.”

body.plain:
Bryce Ross-Johnson, known by his stage name Bryce Vine is an American rapper and singer from New York City, New York.
Bryce Vine showed an early interest in music, teaching himself guitar at 13 and later auditioning for the Fox show Glee.
While attending Berklee College of Music, he met Nolan Lambroza, who signed him to his record label, Kiva House Lambroza. Vine has released two EPs, Lazy Fair and Night Circus, and the hit single “Drew Barrymore.”

songs.title: Drew Barrymore

description.plain:
“Drew Barrymore” is a song about Bryce Vine’s ideal girl. The name of the song comes from the actress who Bryce Vine first saw in The Wedding Singer and was someone who he thought represented all the qualities he would want in a significant other. In the song Bryce talks about how he loves this girl for who she is and how they make him feel which is one of the most important qualities for him in a significant other.

The song also features pop culture references to famous couples who loved each other for who they were such as Bonnie and Clyde, a criminal couple who travelled the US during the Great Depression and became known for their bank robberies, as well as Harrelson and Juliette, lead actors from the 1994 crime film, Natural Born Killers, who portray two psychotic killers who travel around the US and fall in love because they are so similar.

The song peaked at 46th on the US Billboard Hot 100 in 2018 and was later released as part of Bryce’s debut album in 2019, Carnival.

songs.embed_content: Read “Drew Barrymore” by Bryce Vine on Genius

songs.full_title: Sour Patch Kids by Bryce Vine
songs.title: Sour Patch Kids

description.plain: “Sour Patch Kids” was inspired by the stress and burdens of being an adult and a desire to go back to the simpler times of childhood. I’ve always been super nostalgic (perhaps to a fault) about 90’s pop culture, especially the cartoons and video games I grew up on, like Rugrats and Sonic The Hedgehog, and I wanted to make a song that captured that magic vibe.

body.plain: “Sour Patch Kids” was inspired by the stress and burdens of being an adult and a desire to go back to the simpler times of childhood. I’ve always been super nostalgic (perhaps to a fault) about 90’s pop culture, especially the cartoons and video games I grew up on, like Rugrats and Sonic The Hedgehog, and I wanted to make a song that captured that magic vibe.

songs.lyrics:
20 ContributorsSour Patch Kids Lyrics[Verse 1: Bryce Vine]
When I was growing up, I had a lot of dreams, my momma told me “Son you could be anything”
Long as you spread your wings, I know one day you’ll be great
Just wait, soon you’ll aim up at the sky and I’ll watch you float away
But, now that I am older, I’ll admit that I am over all the stress and shit that comes from holding life up on your shoulders
It’s a chore, I’m sick of being bored, I’m sick of always stressin over shit I could ignore
I guess it’s just my own immaturity, burnin’ through me internally, take imagination and making it a reality
So, pause. Yo, fuck it, I’ll be right back
Pay a visit to the past, tell them all to kiss my ass for a second

[Hook: Bryce Vine]
I don’t wanna worry bout nothin for a while, I just wanna play around livin’ like a child
With old tunes jammin on my Walkman, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can
I don’t wanna think about anything at all, I just wanna run around doin what I want
With a pretty ass girl and a slow jam, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can

[Verse 2: Bryce Vine]
I just wanna go back to the old school, old news, road rules, fresh prince, cartoons, good raps, dope tracks
I’m not tryin to be on it, I’m just tryin’ to be honest
Packed lunch, school crush, Bus home and play Sonic
I have been there, I have done that, made my mark up on the town
Been stupid, I’ve been lucid, been a menace and a clown
Wow, I’m chillin watchin’ Rocko’s modern livin’ wishin I could find a way to bring back Music Television
No more Jersey Shore’n whorin’ or horribly borin’ versions of shows from Great Britain, they’re written with no vision
Damn, so fuck it I’ll be right back
Pay my tribute to the past, you can all just kiss my ass for a second
You might also like[Hook: Bryce Vine]
I don’t wanna worry bout nothin for a while, I just wanna play around livin’ like a child
With old tunes jammin on my Walkman, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can
I don’t wanna think about anything at all, I just wanna run around doin what I want
With a pretty ass girl and a slow jam, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can

I don’t wanna worry bout nothin for a while, I just wanna play around,  like a child
With old tunes jammin on my Walkman, Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can

I don’t wanna worry bout nothin for a while, I just wanna play around livin’ like a child
With old tunes jammin on my Walkman, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can
I don’t wanna think about anything at all, I just wanna run around doin what I want
With a pretty ass girl and a slow jam, and some Sour Patch Kids and a Coke can12Embed
